source.name: Hash Function 01
source.instructions: Which of the following are characteristics of a hash function? Select all that apply!

answers.answer: Deterministic: the same input always produces the same output
Reversible: the original input can be derived from the hash
Collision resistant: different inputs rarely produce the same hash
Only produce outputs of variable length

source.guidance: Hash functions are characterized by being deterministic (same input always produces same output), fast to compute, and collision resistant. They are designed to be one-way functions, meaning they are not reversible. While some hash functions support variable-length output, typically they map data to fixed-size values.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT identify key characteristics of hash functions
